title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a report parameter of type DateTime in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the default value field (e.g., '55/66/9999'), the value is stored successfully without any error or rejection message.
EB: When creating a report parameter of type DateTime in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the default value field, such as '55/66/9999', the value should be rejected and an error message should be displayed.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a parameter of type DateTime.
4. In the 'Default Value' field, enter an invalid date string, for example, '55/66/9999'.
5. Save the report.
6. Observe whether the invalid date string is accepted or rejected, and if any error message is displayed when saving the report.
